results.title: The Blade
results.brief_description: Visually innovative and brutal in its action sequences, “The Blade” is essentially a traditional tale of revenge, rivalry and romance. In the town of Empire Field, a desolate waste-land laden with booby traps and populated by gangs of bandits, lies the best sword making factory in the country - Sharp Manufacturers. Introduced from the point of view of Ling, the master sword maker’s daughter, she contemplates her place in such a world and dreams of workers Iron Head (Moses Chan) and On (Chiu Man-Cheuk) vying for her affections. When her father hands over the industry to On, he discovers his father was killed by the tattooed bandit, Lung, and vows to avenge the father he never knew. Ling, not willing to let On go follows after him with Iron Head. Overtly concerned with halves and incompleteness, On’s father leaves the legacy of half a sword, On is injured in a fight with bandits and loses an arm, and when he finds the manual that will teach him the necessary intricacies of being a master swordsman capable of taking on Tung, half the manual is missing. On’s incompleteness adds fuel to his fire of revenge to right the wrongs of the dispossessed in a society where only the strong prevail and On rises to become the One Armed Swordsman. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Blackbutt
results.brief_description: The Blackbutt, a majestic gum is felled. The removal of the tree was necessary as a fence nailed to it allowed termites to enter, nest and rot the tree with their activities. The gum is shown in all its beauty; then the preparations for its removal - dismantling the fence and the electricity wires; digging to expose the roots; lopping the branches; cutting the roots. The final act of felling comes as the winch tightens the steel ropes. The termite nest is found in the base and their activities seen in the rotten, gnarled branches. There is no commentary, but specially selected music augments the visual impressions. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: The Blackbird = La Merle (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Norman McLaren imparts unusual activity to an old French-Canadian nonsense song. Simple white cut-outs on pastel backgrounds provide lively illustrations. The folksong, (Mon Merle), is sung in French by the Trio Lyrique of Montreal. This, the only white blackbird in creation, is a wonderful amalgam of Buster Keaton, Marcel Marceau and McLaren.

results.title: The Black swan
results.brief_description: The life history of the majestic black swan is depicted in its natural surroundings of swampland at the edge of lakes and lagoons. The nest which is made on reeds and twigs or any slight elevation in the swamp is defended against all comers. From 2-6 eggs are hatched and the cygnets take at once to the water. By six weeks they are almost adult and able to look after themselves. Swans are nomads and when heavy rain swamps their home they fly off to seek a new one. Scenes are included of other water birds such as pelicans, swamp hens and egrets. No other credits available.

results.title: The Black pirate. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Gregstan Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
An edited and narrated presentation of the duels, sea battles and acrobatics in the ‘Black Pirate’ an adventure film made in 1926 starring Douglas Fairbanks. Includes the famous sliding-down-the-sail stunt. Also stars Billie Dove.

results.title: The Black pages
results.brief_description: Stunning yet restrained cinematography is a feature of this beautifully lit work which demonstrates controlled use of colour in a piece employing controlled kinetic movement within the frame. Considered visual composition and a strong soundtrack support an intriguing storyline.

results.title: The Black lake
results.creator_credit: British Foundation Pictures and Ronald Haines
results.brief_description: The famous asphalt lake in Trinidad is the scene of one of the island’s major industries. The film shows how the raw material is dug, processed, packed and shipped to many parts of the world. Trinidad asphalt is used for floors, roofs, electrical insulation and roads. Roads surfaced by Trinidad Lake asphalt are found the world over. The film includes a full account of operations at the asphalt refinery converting the raw material from the lake into the finished product ready for export.

results.title: The Black death, 1361
results.creator_credit: Leo Eaton, Altug Savasal, Diane Holmes and Maryland Public Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Timeline”.
A dramatic recreation of the social upheaval experienced in the Middle Ages due to the spread of the Black Death. Modelled on a news broadcast, the program looks at the causes and impact of the Plague, and “interviews” key historical figures of the time. At its most virulent, the disease decimated both city and rural populations and created severe labour shortages.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leo Eaton, Altug Savasal, Diane Holmes and Maryland Public Television

results.title: The Black chain
results.creator_credit: Michael Sklar, Carousel Films, CBS Television Network and Joseph Krumgold
results.brief_description: Significant achievements in streptococcus research and the potential cure of rheumatic heart disease. Filmed at the Alfred I. Du Pont Institute in Wilmington, Delaware, showing the work of Dr Arnine T. Wilson. Microphotography shows the actions of white and red blood cells and the virulent form of streptococcus (Black chain) and the defence of one against the other.
